message: how can I send code using the API in a way that it will be rendered using a monospaced font?
I'm just going to write my next bot in Selenium
I'be trying something like the following without success:
;p
is there a timeframe already for this?
I'm not a convore developer, but I'm pretty sure the answer is: you don't
(yet)
the website uses this parameter, but i have no idea whether it is in the api: pasted=true
can test in a moment
hmmm
I'm a convore dev and this isn't supported yet. sorry!
javascript paste that is
from their javascript:
oh, you will, sorry
well, thx a lot then.
hi all, sorry if this has been addressed in another topic but I couldn't find it, so here it goes
we're using the paste action to determine if something should be rendered as monospaced
@dsouza not yet
okay thx!
I'll file a ticket though
@llimllib good suggestion... we're definitely looking into adding more embed types
I guess cowsay through command line will have to wait, heh
@berryp we don't have any plans to support any kind of markup at this time, sorry
I think someone wrote a hack for Propane to display them but it wasn't pretty
maybe sending <pre> might work :-)
just curious
I guess you are right. Every single combination I tried failed miserably. Even using the HTML interface fails if I do not use ctrl+v (or middle button) :-)
oh, okay
sure, but how can I do this?
@leah are there any plans to support a wiki style formatting for identifying <pre/> content in messages (or something along those lines), such as triple braces in Trac?
it'd be cool if there was gist embed support, just like the twitter embed
and they already have an API
@protocool that seems to be the style with embeds these days, google has updated their youtube embeds to be iframes too
That's what I expected - I don't imagine there's a significant use case for markup support.
okay, I've added a way to send code via the api: https://convore.com/api/#topic-message-create
that way, you wouldn't need to send markup, just a gist.github url
that's a really neat idea.
gist has caused me problems because (at least the last time I looked) it relied iframes - probably because a gist can be multiple files...
@protocool I assume it avoids problems of conflicts with the page the widget is embedded into
just specify pasted=true
@leah will the message in live include 'pasted=true' as well?
@protocool not sure... might be part of the embeds... or we could just say that it was pasted
hrm
(eventually)
I'm fine with 'pasted=true' if you're cool with doing the styling :D
but that's just me, maybe other people have different needs
I'm basing my opinion on the assumption that what I get with the json API is exactly what they typed in so...
all I need to know is whether I'm displaying as a monospace multiline or a proportional multiline - which means that all I need to know is whether pasted=true
a json boolean is fine with me
/me wishes pasted=true didn't also rely on at least one newline being in the message body too :-(
same here, I'd be fine with a pasted parameter in the message.

aehm, shouldn't the topics/:topic_id/messages.json API include the pasted parameter? or is that still to come?Also how about renaming that to preformatted or sourcecode. Pasted is the user action that created the content it's not what the content contains.
icing on the cake would be if pasted content is run through pygments then we can add a  shebang in the first line of the pasted content and get syntax highlighting. :)
whatever, but as it currently stands there is no way to know the we should display the content as code.
@adsworth or maybe they can put it in the embed part and we can know that is the part that is pasted
i totally hear you i working on a java client for convore and using java patterns i can do crazy syntax highlighting and even have users add there own syntaxs
